data.description:
This Playbook demonstrates a response to a command and control alert when an organization is operating a VMWare virtualized environment. The individual endpoints are vSphere guests and the network stack is virtualized with VMWare NSX. This allows unique response options including virtual machine snapshots and the flexible deployment of new firewall rules across dynamic infrastructure. We built this Playbook in a partnership with Rackspace and VMWare. As one of the largest vSphere service providers, Rackspace provides experienced insight into the deployment of security automation and orchestration in the virtualized datacenter.

VMWorld 2017 Demonstration: https://rackconnection.rackspace.com/youtube-us-region/powering-next-level-security-with-vmware-technology

cells.block_code:
def on_start(container):
    phantom.debug('on_start() called')
    
    # call 'filter_3' block
    filter_3(container=container)

    # call 'filter_2' block
    filter_2(container=container)

    # call 'filter_1' block
    filter_1(container=container)

    # call 'list_vms_1' block
    list_vms_1(container=container)

    return
cells.title: START

cells.block_code:
def on_finish(container, summary):
    phantom.debug('on_finish() called')
    # This function is called after all actions are completed.
    # summary of all the action and/or all detals of actions 
    # can be collected here.

    # summary_json = phantom.get_summary()
    # if 'result' in summary_json:
        # for action_result in summary_json['result']:
            # if 'action_run_id' in action_result:
                # action_results = phantom.get_action_results(action_run_id=action_result['action_run_id'], result_data=False, flatten=False)
                # phantom.debug(action_results)

    return
cells.connection_name: ip reputation, file reputation, ip reputation, file reputation
cells.title: END

cells.block_code:
def decision_3(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('decision_3() called')

    # check for 'if' condition 1
    matched_artifacts_1, matched_results_1 = phantom.condition(
        container=container,
        action_results=results,
        conditions=[
            ["ip_reputation:action_result.data.*.detected_urls.*.positives", ">=", 15],
            ["ip_reputation:action_result.data.*.threatscore", ">=", 60],
        ],
        logical_operator='or')

    # call connected blocks if condition 1 matched
    if matched_artifacts_1 or matched_results_1:
        set_severity_high(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle)
        return

    # call connected blocks for 'else' condition 2
    set_severity_low(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle)

    return
cells.description: Use custom thresholds to categorize high and low severity events based on the IP reputation from Virustotal and Threatstream.
cells.join_code:
def join_decision_3(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('join_decision_3() called')

    # check if all connected incoming actions are done i.e. have succeeded or failed
    if phantom.actions_done([ 'ip_reputation', 'file_reputation' ]):
        
        # call connected block "decision_3"
        decision_3(container=container, handle=handle)
    
    return
cells.name: decision
cells.notes: Use custom thresholds to categorize high and low severity events based on the IP reputation from Virustotal and Threatstream.

cells.block_code:
def block_hash(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('block_hash() called')
    
    #phantom.debug('Action: {0} {1}'.format(action['name'], ('SUCCEEDED' if success else 'FAILED')))
    
    # collect data for 'block_hash' call
    results_data_1 = phantom.collect2(container=container, datapath=['file_reputation:action_result.parameter.hash', 'file_reputation:action_result.parameter.context.artifact_id'], action_results=results)

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'block_hash' call
    for results_item_1 in results_data_1:
        if results_item_1[0]:
            parameters.append({
                'comment': "",
                'hash': results_item_1[0],
                # context (artifact id) is added to associate results with the artifact
                'context': {'artifact_id': results_item_1[1]},
            })

    phantom.act("block hash", parameters=parameters, assets=['carbonblack'], name="block_hash")

    return
cells.description: Now that our Virustotal threshold has classified the file as malicious we will use CarbonBlack Response to block future executions of that file.
cells.name: block hash
cells.notes: Now that our Virustotal threshold has classified the file as malicious we will use CarbonBlack Response to block future executions of that file.
cells.title: Contain

cells.block_code:
def decision_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('decision_1() called')

    # check for 'if' condition 1
    matched_artifacts_1, matched_results_1 = phantom.condition(
        container=container,
        action_results=results,
        conditions=[
            ["file_reputation:action_result.summary.positives", ">=", 20],
        ])

    # call connected blocks if condition 1 matched
    if matched_artifacts_1 or matched_results_1:
        block_hash(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle)
        return

    return
cells.description: Only proceed if 20 or more detection engines in Virustotal classified the file as malicious.
cells.name: decision
cells.notes: Only proceed if 20 or more detection engines in Virustotal classified the file as malicious.

cells.block_code:
def set_severity_low(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('set_severity_low() called')

    phantom.set_severity(container, "low")
    set_status_resolved_2(container=container)

    return
cells.description: Set the severity of this event to Low.
cells.name: set severity
cells.notes: Set the severity of this event to Low.
cells.title: API

cells.block_code:
def set_status_resolved(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('set_status_resolved() called')

    phantom.set_status(container, "closed")

    return
cells.description: Resolve this event. The enrichment and the history of any blocking actions taken can still be reviewed in Mission Control and reopened if further action is necessary.
cells.name: set status
cells.notes: Resolve this event. The enrichment and the history of any blocking actions taken can still be reviewed in Mission Control and reopened if further action is necessary.
cells.title: API

def set_status_resolved_2(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('set_status_resolved_2() called')

    phantom.set_status(container, "closed")

    return

cells.callback_code:
def file_reputation_callback(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('file_reputation_callback() called')
    
    decision_1(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle)
    join_decision_3(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle)

    return
cells.description: Query reputation aggregators to determine whether the given hashes represent known malware.
cells.name: file reputation
cells.notes: Query reputation aggregators to determine whether the given hashes represent known malware.
cells.title: Investigate

cells.block_code:
def snapshot_vm_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('snapshot_vm_1() called')
    
    #phantom.debug('Action: {0} {1}'.format(action['name'], ('SUCCEEDED' if success else 'FAILED')))
    
    # collect data for 'snapshot_vm_1' call
    filtered_results_data_1 = phantom.collect2(container=container, datapath=["filtered-data:filter_4:condition_1:list_vms_1:action_result.data.*.vmx_path", "filtered-data:filter_4:condition_1:list_vms_1:action_result.parameter.context.artifact_id"])

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'snapshot_vm_1' call
    for filtered_results_item_1 in filtered_results_data_1:
        if filtered_results_item_1[0]:
            parameters.append({
                'download': "",
                'vmx_path': filtered_results_item_1[0],
                # context (artifact id) is added to associate results with the artifact
                'context': {'artifact_id': filtered_results_item_1[1]},
            })

    phantom.act("snapshot vm", parameters=parameters, assets=['vmwarevsphere'], name="snapshot_vm_1")

    return
cells.description: Take snapshots of the detected virtual machines in case they are needed for forensics or recovery.
cells.name: snapshot vm
cells.notes: Take snapshots of the detected virtual machines in case they are needed for forensics or recovery.
cells.title: Generic

    phantom.debug('set_severity_high() called')

    phantom.set_severity(container, "high")
    set_status_resolved(container=container)

cells.description: Query the PhishMe Intelligence platform for threat information about files with the given MD5 hash.
cells.name: hunt file
cells.notes: Query the PhishMe Intelligence platform for threat information about files with the given MD5 hash.
cells.title: Investigate

cells.block_code:
def hunt_ip_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('hunt_ip_1() called')

    # collect data for 'hunt_ip_1' call
    filtered_artifacts_data_1 = phantom.collect2(container=container, datapath=['filtered-data:filter_1:condition_1:artifact:*.cef.destinationAddress', 'filtered-data:filter_1:condition_1:artifact:*.id'])

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'hunt_ip_1' call
    for filtered_artifacts_item_1 in filtered_artifacts_data_1:
        if filtered_artifacts_item_1[0]:
            parameters.append({
                'ip': filtered_artifacts_item_1[0],
                'max_threat_count': "",
                'ph': "",
                'start_time': "",
                'end_time': "",
                # context (artifact id) is added to associate results with the artifact
                'context': {'artifact_id': filtered_artifacts_item_1[1]},
            })

    phantom.act("hunt ip", parameters=parameters, assets=['phishme','protectwise'], name="hunt_ip_1")

    return
cells.description: Query for threat information and observations about the given IP address.
cells.name: hunt ip
cells.notes: Query for threat information and observations about the given IP address.
cells.title: Investigate

def list_vms_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('list_vms_1() called')

    parameters = []

    phantom.act("list vms", parameters=parameters, assets=['vmwarevsphere'], callback=filter_4, name="list_vms_1")

    return

cells.block_code:
def hunt_file_sha256(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('hunt_file_sha256() called')

    # collect data for 'hunt_file_sha256' call
    filtered_artifacts_data_1 = phantom.collect2(container=container, datapath=['filtered-data:filter_3:condition_1:artifact:*.cef.fileHashSha256', 'filtered-data:filter_3:condition_1:artifact:*.id'])

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'hunt_file_sha256' call
    for filtered_artifacts_item_1 in filtered_artifacts_data_1:
        if filtered_artifacts_item_1[0]:
            parameters.append({
                'start_time': "",
                'hash': filtered_artifacts_item_1[0],
                'ph': "",
                'end_time': "",
                # context (artifact id) is added to associate results with the artifact
                'context': {'artifact_id': filtered_artifacts_item_1[1]},
            })

    phantom.act("hunt file", parameters=parameters, assets=['protectwise'], name="hunt_file_sha256")

    return
cells.description: Query across all the data sources integrated into Protectwise for observations of the given SHA-256 file hash.
cells.name: hunt file
cells.notes: Query across all the data sources integrated into Protectwise for observations of the given SHA-256 file hash.
cells.title: Investigate

cells.block_code:
def filter_3(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('filter_3() called')

    # collect filtered artifact ids for 'if' condition 1
    matched_artifacts_1, matched_results_1 = phantom.condition(
        container=container,
        conditions=[
            ["artifact:*.cef.fileHashSha256", "!=", ""],
        ],
        name="filter_3:condition_1")

    # call connected blocks if filtered artifacts or results
    if matched_artifacts_1 or matched_results_1:
        hunt_file_sha256(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, filtered_artifacts=matched_artifacts_1, filtered_results=matched_results_1)

    return
cells.description: Filter the artifacts with SHA-256 file hashes.
cells.name: filter
cells.notes: Filter the artifacts with SHA-256 file hashes.

cells.block_code:
def filter_2(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('filter_2() called')

    # collect filtered artifact ids for 'if' condition 1
    matched_artifacts_1, matched_results_1 = phantom.condition(
        container=container,
        conditions=[
            ["artifact:*.cef.fileHashMd5", "!=", ""],
        ],
        name="filter_2:condition_1")

    # call connected blocks if filtered artifacts or results
    if matched_artifacts_1 or matched_results_1:
        file_reputation(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, filtered_artifacts=matched_artifacts_1, filtered_results=matched_results_1)
        hunt_file_md5(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, filtered_artifacts=matched_artifacts_1, filtered_results=matched_results_1)

    return
cells.description: Filter the artifacts with MD5 file hashes.
cells.name: filter
cells.notes: Filter the artifacts with MD5 file hashes.

cells.block_code:
def filter_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('filter_1() called')

    # collect filtered artifact ids for 'if' condition 1
    matched_artifacts_1, matched_results_1 = phantom.condition(
        container=container,
        conditions=[
            ["artifact:*.cef.destinationAddress", "!=", ""],
        ],
        name="filter_1:condition_1")

    # call connected blocks if filtered artifacts or results
    if matched_artifacts_1 or matched_results_1:
        hunt_ip_1(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, filtered_artifacts=matched_artifacts_1, filtered_results=matched_results_1)
        ip_reputation(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, filtered_artifacts=matched_artifacts_1, filtered_results=matched_results_1)

    return
cells.description: Filter the artifacts with destination IP addresses.
cells.name: filter
cells.notes: Filter the artifacts with destination IP addresses.

cells.callback_code:
def ip_reputation_callback(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('ip_reputation_callback() called')
    
    decision_2(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle)
    join_decision_3(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle)

    return
cells.description: Query reputation services to determine whether the given IP address is known-good, known-bad, or unknown.
cells.name: ip reputation
cells.notes: Query reputation services to determine whether the given IP address is known-good, known-bad, or unknown.
cells.title: Investigate

cells.block_code:
def filter_4(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('filter_4() called')

    # collect filtered artifact ids for 'if' condition 1
    matched_artifacts_1, matched_results_1 = phantom.condition(
        container=container,
        action_results=results,
        conditions=[
            ["list_vms_1:action_result.data.*.ip", "==", "artifact:*.cef.sourceAddress"],
        ],
        name="filter_4:condition_1")

    # call connected blocks if filtered artifacts or results
    if matched_artifacts_1 or matched_results_1:
        snapshot_vm_1(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, filtered_artifacts=matched_artifacts_1, filtered_results=matched_results_1)

    return
cells.description: Only proceed with source addresses of virtual machines.
cells.name: filter
cells.notes: Only proceed with source addresses of virtual machines.

cells.block_code:
def decision_2(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('decision_2() called')

    # check for 'if' condition 1
    matched_artifacts_1, matched_results_1 = phantom.condition(
        container=container,
        action_results=results,
        conditions=[
            ["ip_reputation:action_result.data.*.detected_urls.*.positives", ">=", 15],
        ])

    # call connected blocks if condition 1 matched
    if matched_artifacts_1 or matched_results_1:
        NSX_block_IP(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle)
        return

    return
cells.description: Only proceed for IP's that resolved to 15 or more positives.
cells.name: decision
cells.notes: Only proceed for IP's that resolved to 15 or more positives.

cells.block_code:
def NSX_block_IP(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None):
    phantom.debug('NSX_block_IP() called')
    
    #phantom.debug('Action: {0} {1}'.format(action['name'], ('SUCCEEDED' if success else 'FAILED')))
    
    # collect data for 'NSX_block_IP' call
    results_data_1 = phantom.collect2(container=container, datapath=['ip_reputation:action_result.data.*.ip', 'ip_reputation:action_result.parameter.context.artifact_id'], action_results=results)

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'NSX_block_IP' call
    for results_item_1 in results_data_1:
        parameters.append({
            'ip': results_item_1[0],
            # context (artifact id) is added to associate results with the artifact
            'context': {'artifact_id': results_item_1[1]},
        })

    phantom.act("block ip", parameters=parameters, assets=['vmwarensx'], name="NSX_block_IP")

    return
cells.description: Now that we have determined that an IP is probably malicious we can add an NSX rule to block access to it.
cells.name: block ip
cells.notes: Now that we have determined that an IP is probably malicious we can add an NSX rule to block access to it.
cells.title: Contain

data.notes:
This playbook uses the following Apps:
 - VMWare vSphere (list vms, snapshot vm) [asset name = vmwaresphere] - enumerates and snapshots virtual machines
 - VMWare NSX (block ip) [asset name = vmwarensx] - allows control of the virtual firewall in NSX
 - CarbonBlack Response (block hash) [asset name = carbonblack] - denies execution of malware using the CarbonBlack Response banning blacklist
 - ProtectWise (hunt file, hunt ip) [asset name = protectwise] - supports queries across all data sources ingested into ProtectWise
 - PhishMe (hunt file, hunt ip) [asset name = phishme] - supports queries against PhishMe's threat intelligence database
 - ThreatStream (file reputation, ip reputation) [asset name = threatstream]  - provides threat intelligence data for reputation queries
 - VirusTotal (file reputation, ip reputation) [asset name = virustotal]  - supports reputation queries against a large set of detection engines

Deployment notes:
 - the command and control alert that initiates this Playbook could come from a wide variety of SIEM's or other alerting systems. when available the alert should be configured to populate the following CEF fields:
        fileHashSha256 and fileHashMd5 - the hashes of any files found associated with the communicating malware
        destinationAddress - the external IP address of the detected command and control server
        sourceAddress - the internal IP address of the machine found calling out to the command and control server
 - the thresholds for threat intelligence and reputation services can be adjusted according to desired sensitivity
 - virtual machine snapshots can be analyzed statically or resumed in a quarantined environment for further analysis
